item.title: Shootin' Stuff
item.description: So, the first topic I’d like to address here with regard to my skirmish rules is of central importance to a modern/sci-fi wargame: shooting stuff. I’m going to start out a little theoretical and then move into some practicalities as they relate to those theories. So, the way I see it, in a skirmish wargame, shooting has two main intentions: to control movement and to remove enemy fighters. The second is fairly obvious, but there are some implications to it I want to discuss, so I’ll start with “controlling movement”.

item.title: Necromunda Skirmish Redux
item.description: So, awhile back I started on the somewhat ambitious project of coming up with some miniature skirmish rules that would be extremely customizable but still balanced for competitive play. I started with the notion of wanting to play “Necromunda” but with more individuality and perhaps a heavier story focus. So, a few months back, I went through the Necromunda, Mordheim, and Inquisitor rules and looked for ideas to modify, incorporating ideas from a WWII skirmish game my friend Lance and I developed a few years back (initially based on Games Workshop’s Lord of the Rings game, but since modified beyond recognition).
